pullRequest.body:
Redefine `IsCyclic` without `Subgroup` dependency, move the definition to `Algebra/Group/Defs`.

---
I'm going to prove that certain groups aren't cyclic, and the relevant file doesn't import `SpecificGroups/Cyclic`.
I added `import Mathlib.Logic.Function.Defs` to `Algebra.Group.Defs` to have `Surjective`.

<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [732870eb70](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15544/commits/732870eb7025a035958f9fc887bd3e4e15fe6d33)

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.Logic.Function.Defs | 24 | 16 | -8 (-33.33%) |
| Mathlib.Algebra.Group.Defs | 45 | 55 | +10 (+22.22%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
|<details><summary>13 files</summary> `Mathlib.Logic.Nonempty` `Mathlib.Logic.Function.ULift` `Mathlib.Logic.Function.Defs` `Mathlib.Logic.Nontrivial.Defs` `Mathlib.Control.Traversable.Basic` `Mathlib.Control.Basic` `Mathlib.Logic.Function.CompTypeclasses` `Mathlib.Data.TwoPointing` `Mathlib.Logic.Relator` `Mathlib.Data.Option.NAry` `Mathlib.Data.Prod.PProd` `Mathlib.Data.Bool.Basic` `Mathlib.Control.Functor`</details>|-8|
|<details><summary>3 files</summary> `Mathlib.Control.Applicative` `Mathlib.Control.Traversable.Lemmas` `Mathlib.Tactic.DeriveTraversable`</details>|-7|
| `Mathlib.Data.List.Defs`|-6|
| `Mathlib.Data.Nat.Cast.NeZero`|5|
|<details><summary>4 files</summary> `Mathlib.Algebra.Group.Commute.Defs` `Mathlib.Data.Nat.Cast.Defs` `Mathlib.Data.Int.Cast.Defs` `Mathlib.Algebra.Group.Semiconj.Defs`</details>|9|
|<details><summary>8 files</summary> `Mathlib.Algebra.Group.Commutator` `Mathlib.Data.List.EditDistance.Defs` `Mathlib.GroupTheory.EckmannHilton` `Mathlib.Algebra.Group.Defs` `Mathlib.Algebra.Group.Invertible.Defs` `Mathlib.Tactic.Measurability` `Mathlib.Algebra.PEmptyInstances` `Mathlib.Algebra.Group.MinimalAxioms`</details>|10|

</details>

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ IsCyclic.exists_generator`
`+ exists_zpow_surjective`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.
@semorrison what was the rationale for `assert_not_exists Function.Injective`?
It was added in #9606 while removing `import Mathlib.Logic.Function.Basic` which is a bit heavier than `Mathlib.Logic.Function.Defs`.

We've worked hard to get the dependencies for `Algebra.Group.Defs` very low. While I agree `Logic.Function.Defs` is not heavy, it's relative weight for such a low-level file is still relatively high. So, personally, I'd prefer to have another solution here.

Maybe expand the definition of `Function.Surjective` locally in this file, and add the actual `Function.Surjective` lemma in a later file?

@j-loreaux 
What if I move everything but the *definitions* from `Logic/Function/Defs`, so that it becomes a very light dependency?
Is there harm in just making a new file?
BTW, the only new Mathlib imports that come with `Function.Defs` are `Tactic.AdaptationNote` and `Attr.Register`. Probably, the script reports Batteries imports too.

> Is there harm in just making a new file?

What do you suggest to move to a new file?
`IsCyclic/IsAddCyclic` to `Algebra.Group.IsCyclic`?
I would expect that `Algebra/Group/IsCyclic` is a file with basic properties of `IsCyclic`, not a file with the definition.
Another option is to move everything but definitions from `Logic/Function/Defs` to a new file (or to `Function/Basic` if every file that needs them imports `Basic`).
@j-loreaux What are the benefits of not importing `Function/Defs` in `Algebra/Group/Defs`?

Ah, I didn't see your earlier comment. I think I'm okay with the new imports pulled in by `Function.Defs`, but I would like other input.

My goal here is just to be very stingy with respect to imports of low-level files so that we don't end up slowly migrating back to the old paradigm.

Whoever looks at this, tha main question is should we import `Logic.Function.Defs` into `Algebra.Group.Defs`. Ultimately, I'm okay with it, but @mattrobball suggested moving to another file, which I also think is a good option. Please weigh in or merge.

maintainer merge
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by j-loreaux.
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10343589337/job/28627902065)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10343589337/job/28627902169)

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - refactor(Cyclic): redefine, move definition

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Order/Group): a nontrivial densely linear ordered group isn't cyclic
[Merged by Bors] - feat(Topology/Order/Group): zmultiples aren't dense

It was added in #9606 while removing `import Mathlib.Logic.Function.Basic` which is a bit heavier than `Mathlib.Logic.Function.Defs`.

We've worked hard to get the dependencies for `Algebra.Group.Defs` very low. While I agree `Logic.Function.Defs` is not heavy, it's relative weight for such a low-level file is still relatively high. So, personally, I'd prefer to have another solution here.
